column2: qŭóniam ego in innocèntia mea ingrèssus sum
column3: et in Dòmino sperans non infirmábor. ^ Judge me
column5: for I have walked in my innocence
column6: and I have put my hope in the Lord and shall not be weakened.

column3: et tenta me~; ure renes meos et cor meum. ^ Prove me
column5: and try me~; burn my reins and my heart.

column1: 3 ^ Qŭóniam misericórdia tua ante òculos meos est
column2: et complácui in veritáte tua. ^ For thy mercy is before my eyes
column3: and I am well pleased with thy truth.

column2: et cum iníqŭa gerèntibus non introíbo. ^ I have not sat with the council of vanity
column3: and with the doers of unjust things I will not enter.

column2: et cum ìmpiîs non sědébo. ^ I have hated the assembly of the malignant~; and with the wicked I will not sit.

column3: ^ I will wash my hands among the innocent

column2: et enárrem univèrsa mirabìlia tua. ^ that I may hear the voice of thy praise
column3: and tell of all thy wondrous works.
et locum habitatiónis glóriaĕ tuaĕ. ^ I have loved
column6: and the place where thy glory dwelleth.

column4: et cum vìrîs sángŭinum vitam meam
column7: with the wicked~; nor my life with bloody men

column1: 10 ^ In quórum mánibus iniqŭitátes sunt~; dèxtera eórum repléta est munèribus. ^ in whose hands are iniquities~; their right hand is filled with bribes.
11 ^ Ego aŭtem in innocèntia mea ingrèssus sum~; rèdime me
column2: et miserére mei. ^ But as for me
column3: I have walked in my innocence~; redeem me

column1: 12 ^ Pes meus stètit in dirécto~; in ecclésiîs benedícem te
column2: Dòmine. ^ My foot hath stood in the direct way~; in the churches I will bless thee
